intro: Randia texensis, commonly known as Texas randia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are small, white or pink, and clustered in inflorescences, attracting various pollinators.
